PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 1 Among photovoltaic polymers , regioregular poly(3-hexylthiophene) ( P3HT ) has been extensively studied.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Here are the "Property Name" entities in the paragraph:

1. regioregular poly(3-hexylthiophene) (P3HT)

In this paragraph, "regioregular poly(3-hexylthiophene)" is a property name because it describes a specific type of polymer, and "P3HT" is a property name because it is an abbreviation for the full name of the polymer.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

Sure, here's the updated list of entities that refer to Material Property:

1. regioregular poly(3-hexylthiophene) (P3HT)

The term "regioregular" refers to the molecular structure of the polymer, specifically the arrangement of the monomer units in the polymer chain. "Poly(3-hexylthiophene)" refers to the chemical composition of the polymer, specifically the presence of thiophene units in the polymer chain. "P3HT" is an abbreviation for the full name of the polymer, which is a material property.

Therefore, the entities that clearly refer to Material Property in the given paragraph are:

1. regioregular poly(3-hexylthiophene) (P3HT)

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's the valid entities presented as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name":

| Property Name |
| --- |
| regioregular poly(3-hexylthiophene) |
| P3HT |

Note that "regioregular poly(3-hexylthiophene)" and "P3HT" are the same material property, but they are presented in different forms. "Regioregular poly(3-hexylthiophene)" is the full name of the material, while "P3HT" is an abbreviation for the full name.
